title: I honestly don't think Sated Devourer is that broken
body:
I think it's just a matter of, "Out with the old, in with the new!!  Didn't you hear?!  Tanks are dead!!!" So people stop playing tanks and switch to whatever the new item is.

For example.  If a Yi is facerolling your team for the first 15 minutes of the game, don't come complain about Sated Devourer being broken on the forums - 
- **Because you're being killed by a champion before their devourer is even sated yet.**

It's confirmation bias.  You hear "Sated is OP!!!" So if you see a Yi win ever, you suddenly confirm in your mind; "Yep, Sated must be broken."  The irony is that half the time, they're snowballing before they even Satiate their devourer.  Maybe he was just strong to begin with?

Another irony is that if you assume "lol tanks are dead!!" and thus play only squishies, then of course sated will hit hard on you.  No, they did not suddenly make Maokai any less capable of soaking tons of damage.  Or plenty of other tanks.  They can still get Frozen Heart, Randuins Omen, & Thornmail and make life tough for auto-attackers.

But people seem to assume "TANKS ARE DEAD ROLL OUT THE SQUISHIES!!!! WTF A MASTER YI KILLED ME, AS AN IMMOBILE SQUISHY, WITH AN INCOMPLETE DEVOURER?!?!!?!!  **SATED IS BROKEN!!!!!!!!!!!!**"


...lol


Disclaimer: I might be completely wrong! {{summoner:21}}

I just went 29-11 with Graves and 20-5 with Miss Fortune, both games I died to someone who unfairly killed me (Udyr and Jax) due to Sated Devourer, actually, they weren't even fed or close to being fed until after they got it and were falling behind.

The item is broken, I don't like how I can be insanely fed but still be insta'ed by someone simply because they have Sated + BoRK and/or Wit's End.
Uh...you're a squishy ADC, Jax and Udyr are REALLY damn good at killing squishies, sated devourer or no

The fact I'm going 29-11 vs someone who went about 18-16, and he still can insta me with 0 counterplay is ridiculous. I could kill him by all means before he got Sated, afterwards it was a totally different story and unless I dashed, flashed, healed,  used Youmuu's, and ult'ed to kite him and blow him up, he was just going to kill me in 3 auto attacks at the most.

That argument is pretty flawed considering I could kill them both really easily until they got Sated.

If you are 29-11 vs someone who is 18-16, keep in mid that you:

1. actually are only 2000-3000 gold up, which, by that point of the game, is pretty meaningless, as that's the difference between being 5 slotted and 6 slotted.

2. are a squishy ADC against 2 of the best dueling bruisers in the game.

3. the very fact that such high kill counts are there means that you failed to finish the game.

While I think Sated devourer in its current state is definitely very strong (OP or not, I can't say because I've won a few games vs the supposed Sated devourer abusers), your presented argument is pretty dang flawed as well

18-16 means they might have died a lot, but they still have all the gold they have from what they farmed and who they killed

So, that argument you present is also pretty damn flawed because I can't see your match history of said games and quite frankly for all I know, you probably killed them off in teamfights while they were peeled away from you but when they ran into you in a 1v1 they had enough items with sated devourer to crush you

I don't know where you are getting your numbers. If Yi pops his Wuju style active and skirmishers at the same time, he can EASILY do 3k true damage in 5 seconds. And he can do that about every 45 seconds. If he is at full build, he will do over 5k. Not even counting the BotRK % damage or crits.

Although Yi is the most common case, it is not just about him. The item is too OP and stupidly broken. I have seen a Diana wining a 4 v 5 game single handedly after completing it. Their team was pretty behind but it didn't matter cause the only thing she needed to do was to go in kill or burst 3 or 4 of us before dying and her team and she just collected the kills. Same goes for many other champs. Kayle is a god when she hits sated, udyr can destroy all the towers in a lane with just 1 wave of minions. Even with hard cc, you can't do anything to many of them. Altough Yi maybe the most abusing one, the problem is not starts and ends with him. Every game I played since the release is between a sated jungler vs another sated, the other enhancements are useless. Also it takes away importance of objectives. Drag is meaningless after getting sated, and it just becomes a game to hunt for fun cause it doesn't help with anything.

Addition to those problems, ganging became something useless for junglers. I literally don't get any single gang in 4 out of 5 matches, and no other lane is in different condition. Also this item provokes lane smiting for some champs, rather than ceasing it. It takes 15-20 min to get sated for junglers, and it takes extra 3-7 minutes for the other smiter to get sated, and with 1 sated smiter who is just pushing the enemy into base, other one has a lot of free camps to clear. After getting 2 sateds, nothing stops them, they tear down every champ, tower, inhib in less than 5 secs. 

People say if you let jungler become salted, it s your fault, however it is nearly impossible to deny the enemy jungler from all of his camps, crabs and from dragon. And even though you do it, he can still avoid team fights and farm up while you are fighting and can get sated and start ripping your team apart. It is okay to play the game with a split pushing hero or with a pick up comp, however both of the possibilities should be as powerful as the other one. Right now sated is thousand acres above all the other composition possibilities. No matter what you do, you can't win the game if you don't have a jungler with devour. This item is completely broken and needs to be removed with a hotfix as soon as possible

This item is beyond broken. I pretty much main Shaco so counter jungling is my thing naturally. I go into a devourer Yi's jungle early on and first blood him and taking control of both his buffs for the entire game and even taking some of his camps from time to time. Even with all this it still wasn't enough because he got sated anyway and proceeded to 1v5 our entire team every fight. Keep these junglers behind? Please, you're only delaying the inevitable.

However if we don't deny him from his camps or do nothing and just focus on getting much ahead of other lanes, SD user can finish up the item in less than 20 mins, around 15 to 17 minute mark and after that point how much advantage you have created does not matter because it is nearly impossible to create an advantage that could exceed a SD and BoTRK, which goes along with each other so well.

If their jungler is SD and yours isn't, you better have at LEAST two turrets taken by that point. The amount of map pressure and pick potential that gives you is more than enough to snowball the game if you play it out properly.  You need to play well in order to beat it, that's all. I'm pretty sure it was oddone who called it an overall bad item, because if the other team plays correctly, the other team smacks you into  the dirt and snowballs so hard SD dosen't matter.

The thing is two turrets isn't gonna be important because even with pick potential and map pressure, the SD still can prevent and take control of the snowball. Like you said with a well played and designed team you can win against it but you are missing one point. Not all of us is at plat or diamond level, let alone oddone's level. The item needs a perfect counter and perfect play to be stopped. For high levels of play this could be possible but in low ladders it is just not.

I won games against it too, even with junglers with different enchants, however wining against is does not make it healthy. One small mistake can let the item user snowball harder than any other champ in game. One small mistake, that's all it takes. Play perfectly for 15 mins. of game and made a mistake, and you lost the game. An item shouldn't be giving that much of a potential in my opinion. 

Also stacking item has always been a huge problem, i.e. feral flare, and now the history is repeating itself again. I am pretty sure some pros will try it on LCS and LPL (hope it is correct name for Chinese or Korean pro leagues), and we'll see how it can be effective or how it can be countered. But never forget, this game is for every player, not for only high level players. If an item is abused at lower ladders which contains over 70 percent of the player base, than there is a problem Riot has to look into.

If it weren't then darius would be even MORE useless than he is now, riven would be removed from the game, and tryndamere would be the new mascot for top lane. Balancing for people who can't play the game dosen't make sense. It's better to balance around the top level of play in any game.

People can't handle assassins remember? And essentially, that's what SD champions are.

The 5 dragon threat will always be a thing, so you have to secure at least one. That hasn't changed.

Do you mean "ganking" (when a jungler comes to your lane for a kill) or "ganging (up)" (grouping up as 4 or 5 people). No offense but I'm a little confused as to what you mean. 
If it's the first one, then ... no, sated devourer champions do care about how strong the enemy laners are. If it's the second one and you have a problem with split push, it's a matter of vision control.

I'd also like to say I've won multiple games with Tahm Kench jungle and yes, I did play him as a Cinderhulk tank. Heck, he's not even an ideal jungler, his clear sucks.

I know people can't handle assassins and I know that SD champs are assassins too. I am fine with assassins, it's their job to kill the squishies and die or barely live if caught between enemy team. Also tanks should be by definition assassins natural enemy. However SD case changes everything. SD user can literally go in, kill everyone without a noticeable HP lose. It would have been fine if they operate as assassins, killing 1 to 3 champs and dying or barely surviving, but current state of the item is making them gods that can 1 v 5 and probably live with decent health.

Second thing, of course dragon is an important objective and 5 drake is always gonna be thing, however currently securing 1 or 2 dragons doesn't matter for the enemy SD user, because whenever he finishes his SD, our team is completely denied from leaving the base. He can just zone us into one lane or inside the base and forget about dragon, because you won't be getting it and he doesn't need to take it at all after SD. Thus it becomes something to hunt for fun rather than very important objective to their team.

About ganging thing, I meant jungler coming into the lane and ganging. Sorry for the miscommunication, I am not a native speaker. About it, they really don't care that much about enemy lanes getting stronger because they know that even a bad doing lane could farm under turret without feeding the enemy to a level where SD can't exceed. So they don't care about ganging and stacks up constantly until he reaches the point, which is around 20 minute for most SD users. And addition to that if the enemy jungler is also a SD user, it becomes which one finishes the item first so deny the other from all of his camps. In that scenario no one gets a gang, so it is pretty much 1 v 1 lane where it is pretty hard to feed the enemy into a god level.

Congratz on your victory with Tahm jungle, I want to try it out sometime. It is manageable to win with Tahm, but did you have a SD user in the enemy team, which is quite likely because it is out of control right now? However, even though you won against SD junglers, it doesn't mean the item isn't broken after completion.
